keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Peter Hancock, the chief executive of the American International Group, did not rule out strategic changes to escape heightened regulatory scrutiny.

headline.print_headline: A.I.G.’s Chief Says Insurer Is Reducing Its Risks
headline.main: A.I.G. Considers How to Act With Sifi Tag

snippet: Peter Hancock, the chief executive of the American International Group, did not rule out strategic changes to escape heightened regulatory scrutiny.
abstract: American International Group chief executive Peter Hancock says insurer is taking steps to firm up its finances and reduce risk; reports first-quarter profit of $1.22 a share, slightly better than analysts predictions.
